meanings: to feel (sensation, emotion, call of nature, etc.)

related.meaning: organisasi, sponsor, untuk menjadi tuan rumah

lessons.japanese: 会合をできる限り早急に開催することを我々は要求する。
lessons.indonesian: We insist that a meeting be held as soon as possible.

lessons.japanese: １０月に総会を開催すべきだという提案があった。
lessons.indonesian: There was a suggestion that the general meeting should take place in October.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は来週パーティーを催す。
lessons.indonesian: She will give a party next week.

lessons.japanese: 彼らは今晩パーティーを催すことになっている。
lessons.indonesian: They are to hold a party tonight.

lessons.japanese: 彼は勉強を始めるとどうして眠気を催すのだろうか。
lessons.indonesian: Why should he feel drowsy whenever he begins to study?

lessons.japanese: 彼は勉強を始めるとどうして眠気を催すのだろうか。
lessons.indonesian: Why does he become drowsy whenever he begins to study?

lessons.japanese: 会合をできる限り早急に開催することを我々は要求する。
lessons.indonesian: We insist that a meeting be held as soon as possible.

lessons.japanese: １０月に総会を開催すべきだという提案があった。
lessons.indonesian: There was a suggestion that the general meeting should take place in October.

lessons.japanese: 彼は勉強を始めるとどうして眠気を催すのだろうか。
lessons.indonesian: Why should he feel drowsy whenever he begins to study?

lessons.japanese: 彼らは今晩パーティーを催すことになっている。
lessons.indonesian: They are to hold a party tonight.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は来週パーティーを催す。
lessons.indonesian: She will give a party next week.

lessons.japanese: 彼は勉強を始めるとどうして眠気を催すのだろうか。
lessons.indonesian: Why does he become drowsy whenever he begins to study?

lessons.japanese: トムが主催するパーティーに招かれた。
lessons.indonesian: I was invited to Tom's party.
